repnme.cdata!:
Latvia - Liepaja Region Solid Waste
            Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Liepaja Region Solid
            Waste Management Project for Latvia were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was high, the Bank performance was highly satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was highly satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the Project Implementation Unit
            (PIU) should be integrated into the management structure of
            the project rather than operate as a separate unit. In this
            way its competence will be retained within the project and
            not lost at the end of contract period. The Business Plan
            for the company, drawn up by foreign consultants, proved to
            be: too complicated for management. Establishment of such
            long-term company strategies will make sense only for
            already well-established entities and not for start-up
            companies as Liepajas Ras Ltd (L-RAS). The same comment
            applies to the technical assistance on the financial models
            developed by a swedish consultant. European Union (EU)
            accession and related harmonization of local legislation
            with the EU acquis required additional efforts of
            cooperation of all parties involved in project
            implementation, monitoring and supervision to establish
            univocal understanding of law changes which may impact on
            achievement of project outputs. The language barrier was
            often a problem in getting ideas across; the project should
            have included an intensive english language course for key
            members of management.

TF034676-AFRICA REGION - REVIEW OF
            POVERTY ASSESSMENTS,TF036474-POLAND - FORESTRY DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF036668-LATVIA - LIEPAJA WASTE II PROJECT,TF036748-LATVIA - LIEPAJA WASTE II PROJECT,TF036749-LATVIA - LIEPAJA WASTE PROJECT,TF037693-ECA REGION - ENVIRONMENT PROJECTS,TF037784-LATVIA - LIEPAJA SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT,TF039831-EUROPE & CENTRAL ASIA -

9402836.majtheme: Public sector governance,Urban development,Environment and natural resource management

abstracts.cdata!:
The solid waste management project
            financed by the World Bank and implemented in the Liepaja
            region is a part of the plan aiming at reducing the number
            of currently countless dumps, both legal and illegal, to
            10-12 technologically well-provided regional solid waste
            management sites. So far, there have been around 500 dumps
            in Latvia. Skede is situated in a beautiful and highly
            favored location about one kilometer away from the Baltic
            Sea and near Lake Tosmare, which stretches in the area of
            natural reserve, rich in rare plants. Waste has been
            discharged here since 1960. A facility for collection of
            biogas will be built at the Grobina landfill. At Skede, a
            gas collection station will operate where gas generated by
            rotting waste through a specially built collection system
            will be channeled to a generator producing electricity.
            Under the Kyoto protocol, carbon quotas can be traded, and
            as Latvia does not use its quota in full, it can sell a part
            to another country via the prototype carbon fund.
